types.name: Query
types.description: Top level query object - defines all the access points available via this API.

fields.name: application
fields.description: Fetch attributes about an Application. The Application identifier must be provided as a request header.

fields.name: theaters
fields.description: Fetch theaters for the app. The Application identifier must be provided as a request header.

fields.name: screens
fields.description: Fetch screens information.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: TheaterIdInput
types.description: Filter screens request based on theaterID.

inputFields.name: screenIds
inputFields.description: The screen identifiers to be fetched

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Connection
types.description:
An interface specifying common properties for all Connections per the spec:
https://relay.dev/graphql/connections.htm#sec-Edges

types.name: Edge
types.description:
An interface specifying common properties for all Connection Edges per the spec:
https://relay.dev/graphql/connections.htm#sec-Edges

types.name: PageInfo
types.description:
A type for specifying pagination metadata per the Connection spec:
https://relay.dev/graphql/connections.htm#sec-Edges

fields.name: pageSize
fields.description:
A suggestion from server of what would be an optimal page size for next request.
The field is nullable, and the value will be useful if `hasNextPage` or `hasPreviousPage` is true
This field is just a suggestion from server and clients can still request the page size 
they deem fit for their cases.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Pagination
types.description: And input type to encapsulate the parameters for pagination

inputFields.name: size
inputFields.description: The number of results to show.

inputFields.name: after
inputFields.description:
The starting point for pagination - if null, starts at 0.  Otherwise,
results are after this cursor value.

types.name: Application
types.description: Describes the overall behavior of a specific application.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: Identifier for the application, usually a brand name.

fields.name: homeTheaterId
fields.description:
Home theater for the application
Only here for placeholder, navigation should take it over - deprecated
fields.deprecationReason: Only here for placeholder, use scaffold.initialTheaterId

fields.name: scaffold
fields.description: Defines app navigation structure

fields.name: styles
fields.description: Different styles for the app

fields.name: events
fields.description: A set of events that needs to be performed at app level

fields.name: textStyles
fields.description: Text styles for the app

fields.name: textPresentationStyles
fields.description: Text presentation styles for the app

fields.name: frameStyles
fields.description: Frame Styles for the app

fields.name: colorStyles
fields.description: Color styles for the app

fields.name: overlayStyles
fields.description: overlay styles for the app

fields.name: barStyles
fields.description: Bar styles used in the app

fields.name: fonts
fields.description:
Fonts for the app
An Optional font array, this is the place where brands can override a `FontStyle`. This would be really useful if a brand is using custom fonts.
If an override is not provided then SK would fallback to using system fonts for the `FontStyle`.

types.name: TheaterConnection
types.description: A wrapper type for pagination results

types.name: TheaterEdge
types.description: A wrapper type for individual results

types.name: Theater
types.description: A theater is a container or grouping of content and will contain 1 or more screens.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: Identifier for the theater

fields.name: topTabBar
fields.description: The top tab bar for a theater

fields.name: bottomTabBar
fields.description: The bottom tab bar for a theater

fields.name: navigationBar
fields.description: NavigationBar Styling information

fields.name: events
fields.description: Events associated with theater

types.name: ScreenLayout
types.description: An object that defines the layout for a screen.

fields.name: margin
fields.description: Margin for the screen.

fields.name: columns
fields.description: The number of columns for the screen layout.

fields.name: gutter
fields.description: The amount of space between columns for the layout.

fields.name: tuckingEnabled
fields.description: A boolean value that toggles tucking on or off for all frames in the screen. Individual frames can override this behavior.

fields.name: forcePosition
fields.description: A boolean value that toggles forcing position on or off for all frames in the screen. Individual frames can override this behavior.

types.name: ScreenConnection
types.description: A wrapper type for pagination results

types.name: ScreenEdge
types.description: A wrapper type for pagination results

types.name: Screen
types.description: A screen of content.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The ID of the screen

fields.name: layouts
fields.description: The layout information for the screen and frames in it

fields.name: refreshDateTime
fields.description: The `iso8601` string that represents the date when the Screen should be refreshed. If this field is null or empty, the Screen will not be automatically refreshed.

fields.name: representativeFrame
fields.description: A frame representation of a given screen. For example, if the screen is of type "article", then this would be an ArticleFrame that represented the screen.

fields.name: backgroundColorId
fields.description: background color for the screen

fields.name: initialFilter
fields.description: Defines initial filter to be applied on the screen

fields.name: events
fields.description: Events associated with a Screen of a Theater

fields.name: frames
fields.description:
Gets a connection of Frames for the screen 
Returns paginated list of frames

Argument pagination is nullable, passing nil indicates server that the first page of frames is requested. In response server may choose to return `PageInfo.pageSize`
property to indicate the optimal size for next page.

types.name: FrameConnection
types.description: A wrapper type for pagination results

types.name: FrameEdge
types.description: A wrapper type for pagination results

types.name: Frame
types.description:
An interface describing the minimum set of attributes a Frame must have.
Implementations can and should define additional attributes.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: A unique id for this frame instance

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of frame

fields.name: styleId
fields.description: The style information for the frame. The identifier points to a style from `FrameStyle` array.

fields.name: portraitLayoutID
fields.description: The layout information for the frame to use in portrait.

fields.name: landscapeLayoutID
fields.description: The layout information for the frame to use in landscape.

fields.name: filter
fields.description: The frame filtering information to be used by the `FilterByAction`. If it's not provided, the frame is always visible.

fields.name: events
fields.description: Events associated with frame life cycle and UI events

types.name: FrameType
types.description: Supported frame types

enumValues.name: title
enumValues.deprecationReason: Needs to be replaced by TextFrame

enumValues.name: body
enumValues.deprecationReason: Needs to be replaced by TextFrame

types.name: FrameFilter
types.description: A key-value pair used to filter frames within a Screen.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The name of the property to filter by. (E.g. `date`)

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the property to filter by. (E.g. `2019-04-03`)

types.name: TextFrame
types.description: A frame to use for displaying text content

fields.name: text
fields.description: The text to be displayed

fields.name: underlineDecoration
fields.description: An optional underline decoration for the text

fields.name: events
fields.description: Events for frame

types.name: UnderlineDecoration
types.description: An UnderlineDecoration structure for texts

fields.name: colorId
fields.description: The color identifier of the decoration line

fields.name: thickness
fields.description: The thickness value of the decoration line

types.name: TitleFrame
types.description: A frame to use for displaying title content

fields.name: title
fields.description: The text to be displayed

fields.name: events
fields.description: Events for frame

types.name: BodyFrame
types.description: A frame to use for displaying text content

fields.name: body
fields.description: The text to be displayed

fields.name: events
fields.description: Events for frame

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: default value for the toggle frame

fields.name: minimumValue
fields.description: minimum value on the slider

fields.name: maximumValue
fields.description: max value of the slider

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: default slider value

fields.name: steps
fields.description:
The array determines different steps available on the slider. 
This is an optional value, and the steps would be available only if this array is provided. Otherwise there would be Continuous tracking.
Example = [1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5, 3.0, 3.5]
[minValue-----1.0-----1.5----2.0----2.5----3.0----3.5----maxValue]
in this example the slide would be divided in 8 different control points (6 steps + 2 min/max), As user moves to any control point the 
value provided at corresponding index in this array would be supplied to the defined `slide` action.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

fields.name: kern

A positive or negative value to increase or decrease the spacing between characters in the text, more correctly known as 'letterSpacing'. 
Value given in `em` units. ems = points / font size

An optional font name, provide this if the app is using a custom font
If app is using OS default system fonts, leave this field nil

types.name: FrameLayout
types.description: The layout of a frame.

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: The unique identifier for frame layout

fields.name: columnStart
fields.description: The starting column the frame should use for layout

fields.name: columnSpan
fields.description: The width of the frame, expressed in columns

fields.name: height
fields.description: The frame height

fields.name: ignoreContainerMargin
fields.description: Whether or not this frame should ignore the document margin on layout

fields.name: ignoreContainerGutter
fields.description: Whether or not this frame should ignore the document gutter on layout

fields.name: tuckingEnabled
fields.description: Whether or not this frame is capable of being tucked.

fields.name: wrapping
fields.description: Describes the wrapping behavior of a layout, specifically whether frames can wrap around others, or whether they can be wrapped around.

fields.name: forcePosition
fields.description: Whether the frame is forced to the specified position (obeys the columnStart value), regardless of previous layout.

fields.name: stickyBehavior
fields.description: Whether the frame is forced to the specified position (obeys the columnStart value), regardless of previous layout.

types.name: Height
types.description: The height definition of a frame.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The height measurement type

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the height.

types.name: MeasurementType
types.description: The type of measurement to use (intrinsic (intrinsic) or as a percentage of container height (ch), percentage of frame width (tw), or as device-independent-pixels (dp).)

types.name: WrappingBehavior
types.description: Describes the wrapping behavior of a layout, specifically whether frames can wrap around others, or whether they can be wrapped around. Only applicable for 1-column screen layouts.

fields.name: type
fields.description: Specify if the frame should be wrapped by other frames (wrappable) or if it wraps another frame (wrapping).

fields.name: alignment
fields.description: Direction in which frames are wrapped. Only applicable for wrappable types.

fields.name: wrappableColumnSpan
fields.description: The possible span configurations. Only applicable for wrappable types.

types.name: WrappingType
types.description: Specify if the frame should be wrapped by other frames (wrappable) or if it wraps another frame (wrapping).

types.name: WrappingAlignment
types.description: Direction in which frames are wrapped. Only applicable for wrappable types.

types.name: WrappableColumnSpan
types.description: Describes the column span for wrappable layouts.

fields.name: type
fields.description:
Whether the span is a multiplier of the column width (cw), as device-independent-pixels (dp) or intrinsic to it's content.
we don't support `frameWidth` case for Column Span

fields.name: value
fields.description: The value of the span.

enumValues.name: intrinsic
enumValues.description: `intrinsic` span will ask the frame for it's own width.

enumValues.name: containerWidth
enumValues.description:
`columnWidth` will result in the `Frame` having the width that corresponds to the fraction of the column width.
Example: a value of 0.5 would result in the frame having a width equal to the half of a container's column width.

enumValues.name: deviceIndependentPixel
enumValues.description:
`deviceIndependentPixel` span will result with the `Frame` having its width set to the amount specified. 
The width is set in points of the coordinate system, independent of the device's pixels.

types.name: StickyBehavior
types.description: Used to enable and configure sticky behavior in frames.

fields.name: location
fields.description: Describes where in the visible area the frame should stick.

types.name: StickyFrameLocation
types.description: Describes location of sticky frame

types.name: FrameDivider
types.description: The divider to use between frames in the screen.

fields.name: colorId
fields.description: The color of the divider as a hex string.

fields.name: enable
fields.description: If the divider should be displayed or not.

fields.name: ignoreVerticalDividerGutter
fields.description:
For vertical divider indent -
"false" (default value) 'gutter' is used. 
"true" top and bottom margins are used.

fields.name: ignoreHorizontalDividerGutter
fields.description:
For horizontal divider indent - 
"false" (default) 'gutter' is used. 
"true" left and right margins are used.

fields.name: strokeSize
fields.description: The height of the divider.

types.name: TabBarItemWidthFill

Fill width style fill the title completely on the Item. If the tile width turns out to be more then maxWidth specified
title would be truncated. 
The Tab bar would be scrollable in this case if TabBar width is more then viewport width

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutAnchor
types.description:
The CompositeFrame layout anchor object that will define the relative positioning
for the given frame in relation to its parent or another frame/s.

Notes:

- The anchors will behave different if the relative view is the parent or another frame
- When the relative view is the parent, a `left` anchor means that the given frame, will be attached to the parent's left edge.
- When the relative view is another frame, a `left` anchor means that the given frame will be positioned at the left of the other frame. 
In other words, the right edge of the given frame will be attached to the left edge of the relative frame.

enumValues.name: left
enumValues.description: Leading position anchor

enumValues.name: right
enumValues.description: Trailing position anchor

enumValues.name: top
enumValues.description: Top position anchor

enumValues.name: bottom
enumValues.description: Bottom position anchor

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutAlignment
types.description:
The CompositeFrame layout position alignment object. This defines the alignment between two relative frames.

Note:

When the given frame has a relative view of another frame, the alignment determines the position on the edge that is not anchored.
For example: If we have a frame at the right of another frame (`right` anchor),
the alignment will determine the `y` axis position of the given frame.

- A `top` alignment will put both frames on the same `y` position
- A `bottom` alignment will make both frames share their bottom edge (their `maxY` value)
- A `center` alignment will make both frames share their vertical center.

Another example: If we have a frame at the bottom of another frame (`bottom` anchor),
the alignment will determine the `x` axis position of the given frame.

- A `left` alignment will put both frames on the same `x` position
- A `right` alignment will make both frames share their trailing edge (their `maxX` value)
- A `center` alignment will make both frames share their horizontal center.

Given that the alignment is directly related to the anchors, we have a restriction where only opposite edge between anchors and
alignment will be a valid value. This means that for X axis anchors, the alignment should always be vertical, and for
Y axis anchors, the alignment should always be horizontal.

For example:

- A `left` anchor and a `top` alignment is valid
- A `left` anchor and a `right` alignment is NOT valid.
- `center` is an universal alignment value, so it is valid for horizontal and vertical edges.

enumValues.name: left
enumValues.description: Leading edge alignment value

enumValues.name: right
enumValues.description: Trailing edge alignment value

enumValues.name: center
enumValues.description: Center alignment value

enumValues.name: bottom
enumValues.description: Bottom edge alignment value

enumValues.name: top
enumValues.description: Top edge alignment value

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutRelativity
types.description:
A CompositeFrame layout relativity object.
This represents the relativity of the frame positioning against the parent view or another set of frames.

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutRelativityParent
types.description:
The parent view value as a relative view

GraphQL doesn't support empty types, check - https://spec.graphql.org/June2018/ (Type Validation)
But found following workaround at https://github.com/graphql/graphql-js/issues/937#issuecomment-315845200

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutRelativityLayout
types.description:
A `CompositeFrameLayout`/s view/s value as a relative view.
It takes into consideration the list of Layout Ids as well as the alignment value

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutPosition
types.description: A CompositeFrame layout position object that consists in a set of anchors, a relativity object and a margin value

fields.name: anchors
fields.description: The set of anchors where the given layout will position itself

fields.name: relativity
fields.description: The relative view which the given layout should relate to

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutWidthStyle
types.description: The width Style for composite frame

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutWidthStyleFixed
types.description: The fixed width style, a value must be provided.

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutWidthStylePercent
types.description: The percent width style, a value between 0 to 100 must be provided.

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutWidthStyleFill
types.description:
The fill width style, this would take remaining space on the parent frame
This is a workaround to overcome graphQL support fro empty types

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutOffset
types.description: Margin structure for composite frame

types.name: CompositeFrameLayout
types.description: Layout definition for compositeFrame

types.name: CompositeFrameLayoutMode
types.description:
layout mode for Composite frame
We need this property for improving performance on Android side.
If a frame only composes horizontal or vertical layouts use appropriate value, for all other mixed layouts use relative

types.name: CompositeFrame
types.description: Composite frame definition

fields.name: identifier
fields.description: Common Frame properties

fields.name: frames
fields.description: Array of frames to be composed in CompositeFrame

fields.name: mode
fields.description: The orientation of how to lay out the contents of the layouts property.

fields.name: layouts
fields.description: Array of layouts to be to drawn on the frame

fields.name: events
fields.description: Events for frame

types.name: ImageFrame
types.description: A frame to use for rendering an Image

fields.name: image
fields.description: The image to be rendered

fields.name: events
fields.description: Events for frame

types.name: SwitchToSystemFontScaleSettingAction
types.description: The action would switch / revert app from tracking system font scale tracking

types.name: CustomFontScaleSliderPreviewAction
types.description: An action associated with custom font scale slider

fields.name: frameId

types.name: DisableFrameAction
types.description: Disable a frame for user actions

fields.name: frameId

types.name: ReadUserPreference

types.name: WriteUserPreference
types.description: An action to write an user preference for a given key

fields.name: key

enumValues.name: appMovedToBackground

enumValues.name: tap

enumValues.name: slideEnd

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByUrl`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behaviour of this scalar.
